titles.title: Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria / Yǝweddǝsǝwwa mälaʿǝkt... “The angels praise Her...” / ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi... “Does not the man...” / Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary” / Excerpt from Säʿatat “Horologium” / Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” / Ṣälot zä-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam bä-Däbrä Golgota, Prayer of Our Lady Mary on Mount Golgotha on the 21st of Säne / Excerpt from Mäṣḥafä ṭomar “Book of the Letter” / Ḥaṣurä mäsqäl “Rampart of the Cross”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 2r-6r) II) Yǝweddǝsǝwwa mälaʿǝkt... “The angels praise Her...” (fols. 6v-8v) III) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi... “Does not the man...” (fols. 9r-21v) IV) Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary”: 6 miracles (fols. 24r-48v) V) Excerpt from Säʿatat “Horologium” (fols. 48v-73v) VI) Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 74r-80v) VII) Ṣälot zä-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam bä-Däbrä Golgota, Prayer of Our Lady Mary on Mount Golgotha on the 21st of Säne (fols. 81r-101r) (s. EMML 706-1) VIII) Excerpt from Mäṣḥafä ṭomar “Book of the Letter” (from Heaven)” (fol. 101r-v) IX) Ḥaṣurä mäsqäl “Rampart of the Cross” (fols. 102r-121v) (s. Deborah Lifchitz, Textes éthiopiens magico-religieux, Paris 1940 (Travaux et Mémoires de lʼInstitute dʼEthnologie 38), 87-202).
Additiones 1-5

copyists.copyist: The scribe’s signature (hand e) mentiones Gäbrä Giyorgis as the scribe on fol. 121v.

donors.donor: All names have been erased from the supplication formulas throughout the Ms., except for the name of ʾAṣqä Maryam which has been preserved on fol. 104v (Text IX).

txstates.txstate: Quarter of the back board is missing. Spine cover is damaged. Outer margins of fols. 74r-101v are trimmed. Text abraded on fol. 8v.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (quarter of the back board is missing) covered with reddish-brown untooled leather (quarter cover). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Traces of a chain of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire:
I(8; s.l.: 1, stub after stub of 2; 2, stub after 8; 5, stub after 5; 6, stub after 4/fols. 1r-8) – II(10/fols. 9r-18v) – III(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 5/fols. 19r-23v) – IV(14/fols. 24r-37v) – V(10/fols. 38r-47v) – VI(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 48r-57v) – VII(10; s.l.: 2, stub after 8; 4, stub after 6; 7, stub after 3; 9, stub after 1/fols. 58r-67v) – VIII(6; s.l.: 1, stub after 6; 5, stub after 2/fols. 68r-73v) – IX(8/fols. 74r-81v) – X(8/fols. 82r-89v) – XI(8/fols. 90r-97v) – XII(4; s.l.: 1, stub after 4/fols. 98r-101) – XIII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 102r-109v) – XIV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 110-117) – XV(4/fols. 118r-121v) – B(2/fols. 122r-123v).
Fol. 99 is loosely inserted.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre; hand b: fine and careful, well-trained; hand c: fine hand d: fine; hand e: fine and careful.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 2r-8v; regular Hand b: fols. 9r-47v; the handwriting remains regular throughout the Ms. and characterized by finely shaped, round and broadly spaced letters. Hand c: fols. 48r-73v; characterized by angular shape of letters. Hand d: fols. 74r-101v; regular Hand e: fols. 102r-121v; regular and characterized by round letters.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; two initial lines of Texts I and II; a few lines on the incipit page of Texts III, IV, VI, VII, alternating with black lines; names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 (e.g., fols. 35va, 37vb, 38vb); abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals; some other words like, ṣällǝyu (fol. 6r), täwäkifäki (fol. 14r), ḥǝywätä (fol. 14v), ʿaqqabi (fol. 16v), ḥǝllinahu (fol. 75r), śǝga (fol. 76r).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካሕን፡ (fol. 3r) ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (fol. 5r) ሰ፡ ለ፡/ሰ፡ for ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ (e.g., fols. 8r, 54r, 57v) ሰ፡ for ሰላም፡ ለክሙ፡ (fol. 60r) ስ፡ for ስብሐት፡ ለክሙ፡ (fols. 60v, 61r) ስ፡ for ስብሐት፡ ለከ፡ (e.g., fols. 63v, 64r, 66v) በሰ፡ ሰ፡ for በሰጊድ፡ ሰላም፡ (e.g., fols. 70r, 71v, 72r) መ፡ for መሐልኩ፡ ለኪ፡ (e.g., fols. 97v, 98r, 99r)

additional.cont: Fol. 21v: Supplication and condemnation note.
additional.det: The name of the donor has been erased.
Written in hand b. Names of the donors have been erased.
The text contains many readings taken from the Psalms of David.

additional.cont: Fol. 123r: Protective prayer (ṣälotä käroforon).

extras.extra: - A recent note in Tǝgrǝñña, written in blue pen, mentioning the total number of fols. of the manuscript, 123 fols: fol. 1r. - The scribe used compressed script on fol. 6r. - A text has been erased from fol. 1v. - Tämälläs-sign indicating the place where the ʾarke-hymn, written in the lower margin (of fols. 71v, 72r), belongs: fol. 72r. - Minor notes in the margins: fols. 21v, 22r, 23v, 24r, 37v. - Scribbles and doodles: fols. 11v, 12r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Reading for the part of the day is indicated by its name, ዘነግህ, written within a frame in the upper margin: fol. 50r.

miniature.info: Fol. 22v: Bishop Dexius (Däqsәyos) writing the book of Miracles of Mary (?)
miniature.details: The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 23r: St. Mary presenting a throne and a garment (?)
miniature.details: The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.
